definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: We must now ask you to settle this account within the next few days.
sentences.chinese: 请你务必在这几日内结清这笔账款。

sentences.english: He quitted all scores with his friend.
sentences.chinese: 他与朋友结清了一切债务。

sentences.english: I have squared up with him.
After a long time, the master of those servants returned and settledaccounts with them.
sentences.chinese: 很久之后，主人返回家中，开始与仆人们结清账目。

sentences.english: They settled with Colin at the end of the evening.
sentences.chinese: 晚上聚会结束的时候他们和科林结清了账。

sentences.english: In spite of 2 reminders, the above account still remains unsettled.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我方曾两次催款，上述账目仍未结清。

sentences.english: I squared up with the cashier.
sentences.chinese: 我和收银员把账结清了。

sentences.english: Assist A/P to balance all supplier ledgers and to prepare aging list.
sentences.chinese: 协助应付帐部结清所有的供应商明细帐并准备帐龄表。

sentences.english: If the payment terms is "freight prepaid", issue B/L or AWB against payment.
sentences.chinese: 运费做预付的回运货物，运费结清后出提单。

sentences.english: The customs formalities for the exportation of the following cargo have been duly completed.
sentences.chinese: 下列货物的出关手续已经正式结清。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you have to pay the fine before you check those books out.
sentences.chinese: 很不走运，你得先把罚款付了才能结清书款。

sentences.english: Mr. Lei Upon seeing this, and decoration companies will settle all costs.
sentences.chinese: 雷先生见状，便与装修公司结清了所有费用。

sentences.english: I have a debt to settle with him.
sentences.chinese: 我和他有一笔债务要结清。

sentences.english: Cf. They have not paid their accounts promptly on the set date yet.
sentences.chinese: 他们并不总是在规定的日期按时结清账务。

sentences.english: I think I can square with you at the end of May.
sentences.chinese: 我想我能在五月底跟你把帐结清。

sentences.english: The number of bank accounts that are closed compulsorily has been increasing rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 被强制结清的银行账户的数量一直在快速地增长。

definition: to pay in full/to pay all of a bill/to pay off
to pay back in full/to redeem a debt
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
to repay/to pay off a debt
to settle a bill/to close an account
to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
